title: What is the experience of achieving a state of consciousness through a ritual and why is it important to proceed slowly?
first_phrase: This text discusses the process of achieving a state of consciousness through a ritual, and the importance of taking the time to do it correctly. The author emphasizes the gradual separation of the different "bodies" involved in the ritual, and the observation of their unique attributes and functions. Rushing through the process can cause a negative reaction and prevent the state of consciousness from being maintained. The author encourages readers to take their time and to observe the different elements involved. This will enable them to achieve a more complete understanding of the process and to remember it more fully.

Il modo dell'azione, che per la sua natura non è possibile indicare, sarà conosciuto da ciascuno nel com pimento del Rito, e cosí anche come è opportuno il ri torno, tale che consenta il permanere dello stato di co scienza raggiunto e conseguentemente anche il perfetto ricordo.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the warning of "acting slowly" in magical and theurgic practice is essential to maintain a delicate balance during the experience. Rushing can cause a quick reaction that causes the state of consciousness to vanish, returning the experimenter to the starting point, making it almost impossible to regain that state. Knowing the elements on which one is acting is paramount, and the mode of action and the return will be learned during the ritual to achieve a perfect memory and a state of consciousness.
